channel.title: My monitor is cooler than yours
channel.description: [url=http://vuzix.com/site/_photo/products/big/VR920-Prdt.jpg]http://vuzix.com/site/_photo/products/big/VR920-Prdt.jpg[/url] :cool: Built in stereoscopy drivers, and a head tracker. It even makes non 3d games look 3d, and it makes 3d games look even better.

item.title: My monitor is cooler than yours
item.dc:creator: @Stork Stork
item.description:
@Stork wrote:

On the downside, you look like a knob.

Read full topic
item.source: My monitor is cooler than yours

item.title: My monitor is cooler than yours
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

ninja nub:

Alright, but please don’t sing a song with the word rainbow in it EVER again :P.

Okay
On topic, I tried out fs9 with stereoscopy and headtracking, and it was AMAZING! Flying through the closest city to me [detroit], I actually felt a little bit of fear while flying in between 3d buildings. I still haven’t really tried it much on fsx, though.

Read full topic
item.source: My monitor is cooler than yours

item.title: My monitor is cooler than yours
item.dc:creator: @ninja_nub ninja nub
item.description:
@ninja_nub wrote:

[quote=“cooper, post:38, topic:201986”][quote author=ninja nub link=topic=266647.msg2204443#msg2204443 date=1209105931]

[ img]http://www.myvu.com/Images-myvu/l2/MFiPodsystem.jpg[/ img] These are the ones I was talking about.

I think that would make you look like Geordie LaForge from Star Trek.

Reading Rainbow guy? HE’S AWESOME!
BUTTERFLY IN THE SKYYYYY
I CAN GO TWICE AS HIGHHHHH
TAKE A LOOK
ITS IN A BOOK
READING RAINBOW
WAYS TO GROW
PLAYS TO KNOW
READDINGGGG RAIINBOWWWWWWWWWWWWW
As much as I remember

I lost all respect I had for you.
[/quote]
It was only a joke, don’t take that seriously.[/quote]

Alright, but please don’t sing a song with the word rainbow in it EVER again :P.

Read full topic

item.title: My monitor is cooler than yours
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

I had one of these, seriously it was the shittest thing going. I got it last year so it wasn’t an old one and it looked just like the picture. But it just looks like a screen a few metres away. I’d rather have a HD TV than this waste of money. I had to lie to my mum and say that my eyes weren’t the right shape and I couldn’t see it properly.

It was seriously the gayest peice of crap going.

Read full topic
item.source: My monitor is cooler than yours

item.title: My monitor is cooler than yours
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

1024x768, which is what is standardly used. 800x600 really isn’t that bad, and if you use the hmd mostly for gaming, you’d have no problem running it with 1024x768.

Read full topic

item.source: My monitor is cooler than yours

item.title: My monitor is cooler than yours
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:20, topic:201986”]I’d love a pair of them, too bad I have a million and other things to buy (namely a ps3 + gta).

So my question: Do they work on different things like tv/playstation/xbox?

What I really want to know is if they are out of the “gimmick” stage that they used to be in. Because I remember there used to be a big hype about these things and it turned out that they were shitty(at the time).[/quote]
There are different versions for different appliances. VR920 are computer and xbox 360, but they have the AV920 for anything that uses audio visual I guess. And yes, these are out the gimmick stage - a HUGE improvement over the old vfx1s
I would get gta iv, but instead of a game and a system that I might not play [much], why not get something I’ll use almost every day? If you take out the much that rhymes

Pwnd:

Yeah, I didn’t really know these could be classified as a MONITOR!

Yes they can
But instead of explaining myself, I’ll wait for xxlegitxx to come and do that for me

Read full topic

So my question: Do they work on different things like tv/playstation/xbox?

What I really want to know is if they are out of the “gimmick” stage that they used to be in. Because I remember there used to be a big hype about these things and it turned out that they were shitty(at the time).

item.source: My monitor is cooler than yours

item.title: My monitor is cooler than yours
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:16, topic:201986”][quote author=cooper link=topic=266647.msg2203172#msg2203172 date=1209025686]
I would say so, if you don’t mind 800/600 resolution.
Anyways, there is a 30 day money back guarantee, so you can try it out if you like.
The forums [link on page is wrong] are at http://forums.vr920.com.
And about your brother [older/younger?]: younger
If you don’t use the light shield, you can still see fine. The light shield is $15 more and makes it a lot more immersive, but definitely not necessary. You can also take out the headphones in the headset if you like.
[/quote]

He’ll probably sneak up on me and hit me or some shit.

I’ll probably buy them, but I can’t afford them until next month. I’ve already regged at the forums.[/quote]
Okay, a lot of the issues have been fixed too, so my pair has no problems that the old ones do
Just be careful, if you have a big head it might be a little tight
Anyways, with money back, no harm done I guess [unless they don’t refund shipping, but it was only like 15 dollars… sorry I’m babbling :P]

Read full topic
item.source: My monitor is cooler than yours
